snippet: It was the first prolonged interrogation by an international body and a moment long awaited by abuse victims in many countries.
abstract: Vatican faces barrage of questions from a United Nations panel about how it had handled decades of reports of clergy sexual abuse, first such prolonged interrogation by international body and a moment long awaited by abuse victims in many countries.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.

lead_paragraph: It was the first prolonged interrogation by an international body and a moment long awaited by abuse victims in many countries.

headline.main: U.N. Panel Questions Vatican on Handling of Clergy Sexual Abuse
headline.print_headline: U.N. Panel Questions Vatican on Handling of Clergy Sexual Abuse
